title: Business Live: Sterling slips - BBC News
summary: may and juncker : no deal today .
mps call for probe into sse-npower deal .
toys 'r ' us to close 26 uk stores .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for tonight - thanks for reading .
do join us from 06:00am tomorrow when we 'll have news on rail fares as well as a series of hearings on the impact of brexit on leading uk industries .

documents.title: tech stocks miss out on tax bump
text: microsoft , facebook , alphabet and apple all suffered falls , as investors moved money out of tech stocks and into shares that stand to gain more from us tax cuts .
the tech-heavy nasdaq index finished 1 % lower at 6,775.37 points , with analysts saying tech firms have become relatively expensive after leading the market 's gains this year .
the big driving force on wall street at the start of the week was the us senate 's approval of the biggest tax law change since the 1980s .
it saw the blue chip dow jones and s & p 500 indexes hit record highs during trading , before easing back slightly .
the dow jones eased to a record closing high of 24,290.05 - a rise of 0.2 % - but the s & p 500 finished down 0.1 % at 2,639.44 .

documents.title: uber setback
text: an appeal by uber against a decision on drivers ' employment rights will be heard by the uk 's court of appeal , rather than the supreme court .
the ride-hailing firm lost a challenge at the employment appeals tribunal last month over whether drivers were workers rather than self-employed .
uber hoped to `` leapfrog '' the next stage in the process by appealing to the supreme court - but it has been told it must go to the court of appeal instead .

one of the claimants , yaseen aslam , said : `` now that uber has been denied permission to go straight to the supreme court , they should take this opportunity to work with their drivers instead of fighting them at every stage . ''

documents.title: how easy is it to buy something with bitcoin ?
text: we reported earlier on the rollercoaster ride that bitcoin has been on this year .
but how does it live up to the original goals of its creators as a `` peer-to-peer electronic cash system '' ?
newshour reporter paul coletti tries to find somewhere in central london that accepts the digital currency , with little success
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: oprah 's 'aha moment '
text: oprah winfrey has a reputation as one of the savviest women in us television , building up a fortune of $ 3bn ( according to forbes ) .
the chat-show-host-turned-diet-guru has now added to that with a deal to sell a stake in her own tv network .
media giant discovery has paid $ 70m to increase its holding in the oprah winfrey network .
oprah will retain a minority interest and continue in her role as chief executive of own , discovery said .

documents.title: deal or no deal
text: tonight : as the uk and the eu fail to strike a deal on brexit talks today , we get the latest from @ twitterid and @ twitterid and we talk to irish minister for agriculture michael creed @ twitterid - 22:30 on bbc two
hopefully mogg/farage and cabal are not on for a change ! !
mmm
excellent , thanks for the info .
all the lights went out .
trip switch .
slight return to earth .
just wondering if you could list the misjudgements made by @ twitterid or would you need an extended programme to do that ?

documents.title: deutsche bank shareholder probe
text: germany 's financial watchdog is investigating the stock market disclosures of chinese conglomerate hna group , the biggest shareholder in deutsche bank with a near-10 % stake , according to a german newspaper report .
bafin is examining whether hna correctly disclosed its deutsche shareholdings while building a stake earlier this year , sueddeutsche zeitung reported .
bafin was not immediately available for comment .
hna said its disclosure of deutsche bank shareholdings have been and are correct .
in november switzerland 's takeover board said hna gave partially untrue or incomplete information during the takeover of swiss airline catering firm gategroup last year .

documents.title: uk mulls bitcoin regulation
text: one of the big stories last week was bitcoin 's value breaking through $ 10,000 , swiftly followed by $ 11,000 , before yo yo-ing down to $ 9,000 and back again .
the digital currency is currently trading at about $ 11,500 - just below its record high .
its staggering rise of more than 1,000 % this year has prompted regulators to take a closer look .
the bbc 's tech desk has a story that the uk treasury believes anti-money laundering regulations should be updated to include bitcoin and other virtual currencies .
meanwhile , the metropolitan police says criminals are using crypto-currency cash machines to launder money in london , and are making illegal purchases on dark market websites .

documents.title: sterling steadies
text: let 's take a quick look at the currency markets - the pound has settled down after a see-saw day .
it pushed higher in the morning on reports that the uk and eu would agree to move to the next stage of brexit talks , before slumping again when the deal failed to materialise .
sterling is now trading at $ 1.3465 , pretty much where it started the day ; and is still slightly higher against the euro at €1.1360 .
here 's a reminder of how the pound lost its gains after theresa may 's crunch talks with eu commission president jean claude juncker ended without an agreement .

documents.title: working it
text: some 2,000 teenagers are homeless in mozambique 's capital maputo , where unemployment is rife .
the bbc 's kim gittleson meets some of the country 's keep-fit entrepreneurs who have offered young people a way out of poverty .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: what on earth happened ?
text: meetings in brussels often run over .
maybe it 's the witty repartee , or the chest-beating , or the fact that the institutions here are in the business of trying to get nearly 30 countries to agree on complicated issues .
it is political rocket science .
but when theresa may 's lunch with jean-claude juncker went on , and on , and on , and on , a whiff of doubt started to do the rounds .

i 'm told 20 minutes after [ dup leader arlene ] foster 's press conference , she received a call from the prime minister , in which it was made plain that the dup could not support the proposed deal .
they were not prepared to put up with something that looked like it was a victory for dublin that was , in the dup 's view , ambiguous on northern ireland .
theresa may had broken off her talks with jean-claude juncker to hear that she would not be able to claim victory today .
she then went back into the meeting , and shortly after made her grim statement alongside him .
number 10 sources insist that it was not all about the dup , saying citizens ' rights are still to be completely resolved , as well as the issue of the border .
read more here .
author: Laura Kuenssberg
BBC political editor

documents.title: barclays whistleblower ruling 'next year '
text: an investigation into barclays chief executive jes staley 's attempts to deal with a whistleblower will not be finished this year .
the financial conduct authority will conclude the investigation in early 2018 , after some sources had suggested it could finish this month , according to a bloomberg report .
the regulator and bank declined to comment about the probe , which started in april this year .
newsnight business editor helen thomas tweets

documents.title: even lamborghini now has an suv
text: if you ca n't beat em , join em .

lamborghini - the italian sports car maker best known for outlandish designs and huge price tags - has revealed its first sport-utility vehicle as the volkswagen-owned brand seeks a slice of the fast-growing market .
lamborghini believes the urus could double its annual sales volumes , which stood at just under 3,500 last year .
`` it is a true lamborghini in terms of design , performance , driving dynamics and emotion as well as drivable every day in a range of environments , '' says chief executive stefano domenicali .
that 's all well and good - but what does it cost ?
brace yourself : it 's well over €200,000 including tax .
you get a 4 litre v8 twin-turbo engine with 650 horsepower and a top speed of 305 km/h for your cash at least

documents.title: balance of trade
text: owen paterson told the today programme that there 's only a small amount of trade between the uk and republic of ireland .
the republic of ireland is the fifth biggest customer for uk exports .
the uk is the second biggest customer for irish exports .
and the republic of ireland is a much more important destination for exports from northern ireland than mr paterson 's figures suggest .
it does n't buy 5 % , it buys 37 % .
but northern ireland does indeed buy 1.6 % of the irish republic 's exports .
you can read the full reality check here .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: powdair delays take off
text: start-up airline powdair has abandoned plans to operate flights from six uk airports to sion in switzerland this winter after its main investor walked away .
since then it has had a new investment offer from alternative investors , which powdair says will secure its financial future .
however , the paperwork needed to finalise the new investment will take at least a month , meaning powdair wo n't launch this winter , but next year instead .
`` the company will continue to exist , albeit with a longer timeline for getting planes in the air , '' it says in a statement .
any customers who have already booked will receive full refunds .

documents.title: more pension problems
text: patrick hosking , financial editor at the times , adds on palmer & harvey :
palmer & harvey latest .
this is beginning to look like bhs all over again
£ 70 million in dividends to the preference share holders !
very similar to bhs .
company bumping along on the bottom .
pension fund being depleted while shareholders continue to receive handsome rewards .
how much did the ceo get i wonder , and does he or she have a conveniently domiciled spouse ?
so not .
1 preference shares are what it says .
2 no corporate sale 3 plenty of opportunities for trustees to intervene .
we 've written to tpr , toys 'r ' us and palmer & harvey with questions on the funding of the companies ' pension schemes , inc a £ 584.5m loan write off by toys 'r ' us

documents.title: facebook like ?
text: facebook 's vice president for europe , nicola mendelsohn , has told our business editor simon jack that she 's `` very excited '' about its new london office .
the social network 's expansion will create 800 new uk jobs in 2018 .
ms mendelsohn defended facebook 's tax affairs in the uk , and said many of the new roles would be engineers working on products like its virtual reality headset oculus .

documents.title: slam dunk for us betting ?
text: in the uk , sports fans can bet on pretty much anything - from red cards in football through to the chances of a wardrobe malfunction at half-time in the super bowl .
it 's a different story in the us , where betting on sports is banned in most states .
but a case has just got underway in the supreme court which could overturn that .
the state of new jersey is challenging the 1992 federal law that largely outlawed sports gambling , saying that states should have the right to decide .

new jersey , which includes atlantic city , has lost a string of cases on the issue , but that wo n't stop uk gambling firms - like william hill , ladbrokes , betfair and 888 - or us sports fans watching it closely .

documents.title: pound dips
text: the pound fell below €1.14 and $ 1.35 on news of those last-minute obstacles in the brexit talks , but it has since stemmed the decline .
it 's currently hovering around the €1.1360 mark against the euro - a 0.3 % rise on the day .
against the dollar , it 's down nearly 0.2 % on the day at $ 1.3455 .
`` sterling has dipped more than fallen off a cliff , '' said societe generale macro strategist kit juckes .
`` no deal today does n't necessarily mean the end of the world if we 've got a couple more days left , '' he said .

documents.title: 'keep up the momentum '
text: the british chambers of commerce - which represents firms employing over 5 million workers - has called on theresa may and the eu to reach an agreement this week to move onto trade talks .
adam marshall , head of the business body , says it 's `` imperative to keep up the momentum '' , so that the two sides can start talking about the `` most important '' issues for companies .
theresa may and european commission president jean claude juncker had been expected to reach such a deal today - but said they were still confident of agreeing one later this week .

today 's statements enhance the prospects of finally securing a much-needed transition deal and moving on to the issues that are most important to business , investment and economic well-being on all sides .

it is imperative to keep up the momentum , as it 's high time to answer the huge practical questions on regulation , customs , standards , tariffs and taxes that lie at the heart of what businesses need to know in order to plan for the future . ''

it is now getting very tight but agreement at december # euco is still possible .

documents.title: not coining it
text: the securities and exchange commission 's new cyber unit ( sounds exciting does n't it ) has filed its first charges , alleging that a privately held company called plexcorps and its top two officials had defrauded investors .

the us watchdog said it had frozen assets to halt an initial coin offering , or ico , fraud that raised up to $ 15m from thousands of investors since august by promising a 13-fold profit in less than a month .
remember investors : if it sounds too good to be true , it is .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: what scuppered the brexit talks deal ?
text: the bbc 's political editor suggests that resistance from northern ireland 's dup - which supports theresa may 's minority government - was n't the only obstacle to a deal being struck in brussels .
the prime minister is seeking to reach an agreement on certain issues so the uk and eu can start talking about post-brexit trade .

documents.title: ftse finishes higher
text: the uk 's 100 share index has finished 0.5 % higher , rebounding from a two-month low .
the ftse 100 gained 38.48 points to 7,338.97 as it joined in a broader rally in global stock markets .
analysts said that progress in us tax reforms had given stock markets a boost worldwide , with wall street rising to record highs in early trading .
shares in uk banking stocks were among the big winners , with barclays up 2.4 % and rbs 1.5 % higher .
sky shares finished nearly 3 % higher following reports that rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox has re-opened talks with walt disney .
it 's thought that fox 's stake in sky might be part of a potential sale .

documents.title: portugal wins eurogroup race
text: some other big news out of brussels earlier - mario centeno , portugal 's finance minister , was named the new head of the eu finance ministers ' body , also known as the eurogroup .
the 50-year-old former bank of portugal analyst has been finance minster since december 2015 .
mr centeno , who saw off competition from luxembourg , slovakia and latvia , replaces dutchman jeroen dijsselbloem in mid-january .
portugal needed an eu bailout in 2011 but the economy has been expanding at its fastest pace in at least a decade this year .

documents.title: pound problems
text: the pound has given up the gains it made before theresa may 's talks with european commission president jean-claude juncker .
heading into the lunchtime meeting , sterling rose against the dollar to break above $ 1.35 .
however , the news that mrs may and mr juncker had n't reached an agreement to move on to trade talks sent the pound back down again - as the chart above shows .

documents.title: dup 'sunk brexit talks deal '

documents.title: may 'confident ' of resolution
text: prime minister theresa may said `` some differences remain '' on a couple of issues after her lunch meeting with eu commission president jean claude juncker .
`` we will reconvene before the end of the week , and i am also confident that we will conclude this positively , '' she said .
the pm is attempting to finalise a deal to move to the next stage of brexit talks .
in a joint press conference , mr juncker expressed confidence that an agreement could be reached for an eu summit in 10 days ' time .

documents.title: sterling slips
text: the pound has reacted to the news that the uk and eu will not strike a deal today to move through to the next round of brexit talks .
sterling has fallen slightly against the dollar and euro - easing back to $ 1.3465 and €1.1375 respectively .

documents.title: breakingjuncker : no brexit deal
text: jean claude juncker says it was not possible for the uk and eu to reach a complete agreement today on the end of the first round of brexit talks .
however , he said both sides would resume the negotiations later this week , and expressed confidence they could iron out the remaining issues .
`` this is not failure , '' he says , adding he is `` very confident '' of making enough progress later this week .

documents.title: no deal today ?

but the bbc 's europe editor suggests they wo n't be announcing a deal .

documents.title: pound above €1.14
text: a quick look at the markets , and the pound is hovering around the €1.14 mark - the highest level it 's been against the euro in about a month .
sterling has gained today on rising hopes that theresa may will strike a deal on the first round of brexit talks at a lunch with eu commission president jean claude juncker .
the pound is up 0.8 % against the euro - but has eased back slightly against the dollar , dipping below $ 1.35 .
in case you 're wondering , that lunch has now been going on for three and a half hours .
quite an effort .

documents.title: a bad deal ?
text: the chart above shows how much of the market the uk 's second biggest energy operator , sse , and the sixth biggest , npower , hold .

rachel reeves , head of parliament 's business select committee , says merging the two firms `` risks damaging the development of a more competitive energy market , reducing consumer choice , and threatening to be a bad deal for energy consumers '' .

the competition and markets authority `` needs to look at the potential impacts of this merger and launch a full investigation if there is any risk to competition within the energy market '' , she adds .

documents.title: breakinginvestigation into sse and npower deal ?
text: the merger of uk energy firms sse and npower could be put under closer scrutiny .
mps on the business select committee have called for competition regulators to investigate the deal - which would knock the country 's `` big six '' energy firms down to five .
they have asked the competition and markets authority to look at the potential impacts of the merger , and `` undertake a full investigation if there is any risk of a lessening of competition '' .

documents.title: fancy some venezuelan bitcoins ?
text: this looks like an `` interesting '' investment proposition .
venezuela , the socialist country which is teetering close to bankruptcy , is launching its own virtual currency .
president nicolas maduro has announced the creation of the petro - which will be backed by venezuela 's oil , gas , gold and diamond wealth - to ease the country 's severe financial difficulties .
`` the 21st century has arrived ! ''
mr maduro said in a televised announcement , to cheers from supporters - but opposition mps have poured scorn on the plan .
venezuela is struggling under a heavy debt pile , while many economic commentators have warned that digital currencies are reaching bubble levels .
what could go possibly wrong ?

documents.title: wall street hits fresh records
text: the main us indexes have surged at the opening bell , as traders welcome the passing of a key tax bill in the senate over the weekend .

the flagship dow jones industrial average index , which passed 24,000 points for the first time last week , has pushed further into record territory - rising 231 points , or 0.95 % , to 24,462 points .
the s & p 500 gained 18 points , or 0.7 % , to 2,661 , while the nasdaq composite added 49 points , or 0.7 % , to 6,897 .
us senators passed their version of a tax overhaul bill on saturday , bringing closer to reality president donald trump 's promise of cutting corporate taxes to spur growth .

documents.title: dup reacts to irish reports
text: as we reported earlier , the bbc 's political editor , laura kuenssberg , says the uk could be prepared to accept that northern ireland may remain in the eu 's customs union and single market in all but name .
but , she stressed , the bbc has not seen the draft document nor has it been signed off at theresa may 's meeting in brussels .
here is the reaction from the head of northern ireland 's democratic unionist party - which has a power-sharing agreement with the conservatives in westminster .
`` northern ireland must leave the eu on the same terms as the rest of the uk , we will not accept any form of regulatory divergence '' - dup leader arlene foster on # brexit talks

the `` correct '' decision .

documents.title: best before ?
text: would you buy food which is past its `` best before '' date if it cost only 10p ?
the east of england co-op - which has 125 stores - has become the first retailer to sell products such as tinned and dry food beyond the date producers recommend for best quality .
dr gillian hopkinson of lancaster university says it is `` quite an arbitrary date '' anyway , whereas `` use by '' dates are for consumer safety .
so should we drop the `` best before '' classification as a way of cutting down on food waste ?
`` a date on the product gives consumers confidence and trust in food system - that it has n't been sitting around for ages .
it 's got some value , but [ it 's ] limited , '' she tells the bbc .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: all eyes are on the meeting currently underway between theresa may and eu commission president jean-claude juncker - who is apparently sporting a british burberry tie .
the two are in a behind-closed-doors lunch in brussels to decide whether the eu and uk have made enough progress to move through to the trade part of brexit talks .
i 'll bring you the latest news as it comes through - plus the market reaction and any other breaking business news through the afternoon .
author: Dan Macadam
BBC business reporter

documents.title: does uk and irish trade matter ?
text: former northern ireland secretary owen paterson has told the bbc that there is only a small amount of trade between the uk and the republic of ireland .
but the bbc 's reality check has been crunching the numbers and found out that 's not strictly true .
in fact , the republic of ireland is the fifth biggest customer for uk exports .
and the uk is the second biggest customer for irish exports .
reality check 's conclusion : the republic of ireland is a much more important destination for exports from northern ireland than mr paterson 's figures suggest .
read more here .

documents.title: ftse holds onto gains
text: it 's after lunchtime and so far the ftse 100 has managed to hold on to its gains .
the blue-chip index is currently up 34 points at 7,334.07 .
sky 's the top winner , up over 3 % , following reports that walt disney has resumed talks with rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox to buy `` most '' of its business , including its sky stake .
analysts say investors overall are feeling more positive following progress in us tax reform .
`` we 're seeing a bit of a relief rally .

`` the tax reform is something everyone 's been keeping an eye on , so that 's definitely the main driver in the us and i think that 's trickling over to europe as well , '' says john moore , trader at berkeley capital .

documents.title: end of mega-cheap personal loans ?
text: strikingly cheap high-value loans and long 0 % credit card balance transfer deals could be coming to an end , an expert has suggested .
andrew hagger , an analyst at financial consultancy moneycomms , said that sub-3 % interest loans of more than £ 10,000 were now very rare .
the length of credit card 0 % balance transfer deals was also shortening .
concerns have been raised that an era of cheap loans has led many young people to rely too much on credit .

the city regulator , the financial conduct authority , and the bank of england have expressed worries about young people getting used to credit during a period of low interest rates to pay for basic living costs .
this could expose them to financial difficulty when rates rise .
read more here .

documents.title: demand for toys 'r ' us property
text: retail property expert jonathan de mello tweets :
toys r us not closing as many stores as expected in their uk cva - good news in a sense - with 'only ' 26 out of 105 stores to close .
the uk retail warehouse sector is relatively robust currently and am sure these stores will be re-let relatively quickly .

documents.title: why is this peer furious with charles dickens ?
text: here 's a striking comment from big issue founder lord bird when i interviewed him for this article on renting at the weekend .
he said he was furious with charles dickens ( actually , he used somewhat fruitier language ) .
why ?
because a christmas carol had meant people focussed on helping the homeless only during christmas .
although such help was welcome , he argued that more needed to be done to tackle the many causes of people living on the streets , and to support them throughout the year .
lord bird has been speaking to the the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme about this report on poverty today .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: indian tycoon in court for extradition hearing
text: indian tycoon , vijay mallya has arrived in a london court for an extradition hearing .
mr mallya is a flamboyant figure previously dubbed `` king of good times '' for his lavish lifestyle .
he built his fortune from kingfisher beer , before branching out into indian cricket and formula 1 racing .
mr mallya is wanted in india in connection with money laundering charges .
he says the accusations are unfounded .
mr mallya @ twitterid appears at westminster magistrates court in london for the extradition hearing

documents.title: pound up on brexit buzz
text: the pound has pushed through $ 1.35 , as traders watch developments in brussels where theresa may is meeting european commission president jean-claude juncker .
`` sterling popped as the clouds of uncertainty surrounding britain 's future relationship with the eu parted , '' said neil wilson senior market analyst at etx capital .

`` fuelling the gains , we have apparent alignment on the irish border issue and eu chief negotiator michel barnier reported to have said he is confident that a breakthrough will be reached today . ''
but mr wilson points out that we 're still not sure what the dup thinks , which is crucial as that party is currently propping up the prime minister 's government .

documents.title: gucci investigated over tax evasion
text: italian fashion firm gucci has confirmed reports that police have raided its offices over suspected tax evasion .
prosecutors allege the firm gucci has for years been declaring sales made in italy , in switzerland , saving around 1.3bn euros in tax .
italian newspaper la stampa said police spent three days searching gucci 's headquarters in milan .

documents.title: nationwide apologises for 'technical ' glitch
text: building society nationwide has apologised after customers were unable to access their online and mobile banking services .
the building society blamed a `` technical issue '' , on monday morning , but it did n't say how many people had been affected .
`` we are currently experiencing a technical issue with our internet bank and mobile banking app and we apologise for any inconvenience this may cause .
`` customer service is the highest priority for nationwide and the issue was identified quickly and we are working on restoring full service as soon as possible , '' nationwide said .

documents.title: small is beautiful ?
text: toys r us has confirmed plans to shut `` at least '' 26 of its stores in the uk , putting up to 800 jobs at risk ( see earlier post ) .
the toy chain said the closures would start in spring next year and that there would be `` no disruption for customers '' over christmas and new year .
here , the boss explains the reasons for the shake-up .
our newer , smaller , more interactive stores are in the right shopping locations and are trading well , while our new website has generated significant growth in online and click-and-collect sales .
but the warehouse style stores we opened in the 1980 's and 1990 's , while successful in the early days , are too big and expensive to run in the current retail environment .
the business has been loss-making in recent years and so we need to take strong and decisive action to accelerate the transformation .

documents.title: construction activity 'lop-sided '
text: the construction sector is still `` struggling '' , according to economic forecasting group the ey item club , despite the latest purchasing managers ' survey suggesting activity grew at its fastest pace for five months in november .
the ey item club said construction activity was `` lop-sided '' last month , `` with growth entirely dependent on house building '' .

howard archer , chief economic adviser to the ey item club , said : despite showing activity at a five-month high in november , the purchasing managers ' index ( pmi ) still points to the construction sector finding life very challenging in the fourth quarter .

`` the struggles of the construction sector in recent months has been the result of heightened economic , political and brexit uncertainties , fueling corporate caution over committing to new projects .
`` persistent lacklustre economic activity has also weighed down on construction activity . ''

documents.title: moral bankruptcy ?
text: the unite union has described the royal bank of scotland 's decision to close 62 branches as `` morally bankrupt '' .

in a letter to paul wheelhouse , business minister in the scottish government , the union described the taxpayer-owned bank 's move to shut 62 branches as `` morally bankrupt '' and called for action to be taken .
it said rbs had reneged on a promise never to close a branch when it was `` the last bank in town '' .
mr wheelhouse said powers over banking remain reserved to the uk government .
however , he added that he would seek to discuss with unite officials `` what pressure we can jointly put on the uk government '' .
the treasury said after the closures were announced that it did not interfere with commercial decisions .
rbs has defended the closures , arguing that the move is in response to `` many more customers '' accessing services online or via mobile devices .
read the full story here

documents.title: cbi : uk economy to remain 'sluggish '
text: the business group , the cbi , has predicted that economic growth in the uk will be `` steady but sluggish '' next year .
it has forecast that quarterly economic output will only increase by what it calls a `` subdued '' 0.3 percent to the end of 2019 .
what we 're seeing is a slowing in household spending on our high streets , on going out and other consumer services .
and at the same time the overall fog of uncertainty around brexit is leading to more subdued growth in business investment over the next couple of years .

documents.title: the animal within ?
text: what do unicorns , zebras and sharks have to do with your money ?
find out more by exploring our a-z of business beasts .
full guide : # businessbestiary

documents.title: breakingtoys r us to close 26 uk stores
text: toys 'r ' us has confirmed that it will close at least 26 stores in the uk .
the closures will start from the spring of next year .
the company says that stores will be open as usual through christmas and into the new year .
toys 'r ' us says it wants to transform its business , focusing on smaller `` interactive stores '' and online shopping .
in september toys 'r ' us in the us filed for bankruptcy protection .

documents.title: wizz biz fizz
text: shares in wizz air are the biggest winners on the ftse 250 this morning with a 3 % gain .
while it 's listed in london , wizz is the biggest low-cost airline in eastern and central europe .
in a newspaper interview , its chief executive jozsef varadi talked about expansion plans that will see his fleet of planes triple in size over the next nine years .
the company expects to fly 30 million passengers in its current financial year , which ends 31 march .
that 's up from 24 million in the previous year .

documents.title: uk construction activity accelerates - report
text: activity in the uk construction sector up in november according to the latest survey by ihs markit .
its purchasing managers ' index rose to 53.1 in november from 50.8 in october .
any figure above 50 indicates expansion .
the report suggests that residential work expanded but commercial building continued the declining trend seen this year .

documents.title: beware when transferring pension schemes
text: paul lewis presents the bbc 's moneybox .
watchdog growls softly as crooks continue to rob pensioners do n't treat these things with caution - just say no !
no-one ever lost money by refusing a deal offered out of the blue .
the best way to stop cold calls .
had one for 3 years and no cold calls since .
that remains my 97 year old mother 's approach , whenever she gets cold-called ... and most of the time when she gets called out of the blue by people genuinely trying to help her !
it seems to work quite well ...
this was always going to happen with pension freedom .
why were better controls not put in place ?
fca should be warning about the fees charged by ifa 's when transferring from company pensions .
most of these charges are criminal !

documents.title: beating the baggage bill
text: charging for baggage has become an important stream of income for airlines .
but it vexes travellers , particularly if they have to hang around at a baggage carousel for ages .
instead of getting frustrated , one entrepreneur decided to get even .
adam ewart founded sendmybag.com , which collects your baggage and will have it meet you at the airport .
he tells business live that it 's very popular among professional sports people , who often have lots of bulky items .
it 's also handy for anyone who books their own connections and does not want to collect and check their baggage again .
mr ewart said his firm has never lost a bag .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: tech stocks slide in tokyo
text: falls for technology shares added to a gloomy mood in japan , with panasonic , softbank and nintendo among the big names losing ground .
the benchmark nikkei 225 index closed down 0.5 % , or 111.87 points , at 22,707.16 .
elsewhere in the region , australia 's s & p/asx 200 edged lower .
things were brighter in south korea , where the kospi index rose 1.1 % .
hong kong 's hang seng index added 0.2 % .

documents.title: shares in london move higher
text: the ftse 100 has started the session with healthy gains , up 0.8 % .
sky shares are more than 2 % higher following reports that 21st century fox ( which owns a 39 % stake in sky ) is back in talks with walt disney .
it 's thought that fox might want to sell that stake along with other assets including its movie studio and cable tv networks .
rio tinto shares are 1.6 % higher .
it named a new chairman , simon thompson , who has been serving as a non-executive director .
among smaller firms , shares in car dealership firm pendragon are up almost 3 % .
earlier it announced that its us business was being put up for sale .

documents.title: car dealership to reverse out of us
text: uk car dealership pendragon has said it is putting its us business up for sale following a strategic review .
the company said that given the strong performance of its us business , it had decided that now was right time to sell the unit `` to realise its value '' .
it said early indications suggest the sale would raise more than £ 100m .

pendragon is also planning to close some of its uk dealerships , reducing the number of its premium brand franchises - which cover brands such as aston martin , bmw , ferrari , jaguar and porsche - over the next three years .
in october , pendragon had warned on profits , saying it had been hit by a fall in demand for new cars and the consequent knock-on impact on used car prices .

documents.title: facebook to hire more london engineers
text: facebook has announced today that it 's opening a new london office , creating 800 new uk jobs .
by the end of next year about 2,300 people will work for the social media company in the uk .

nicola mendelsohn , facebook 's europe , middle east and asia vice-president , told the today programme that more than half of the new roles will be engineers working on a variety of products from its virtual reality oculus technology to workplace - its corporate version of facebook .
`` some of the people will be involved in the area of safety , '' she says .
she said the social network 's efforts to police the content on its site is `` being done in different places around the world '' .
the social network , alongside other tech firms , has faced growing pressure to do more to take down material such as terrorist propaganda .
earlier this year it promised to boost its policing efforts by doubling the number of staff in this area to 20,000 .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: brexit breakthrough in brussels ?
text: theresa may will meet the european commission president jean-claude juncker in brussels this lunchtime .
discussions on the remaining sticking point , the irish border , continued through the night .
tony connelly is europe editor for rte , ireland 's public broadcaster .
big day for the pm in brussels .

a `` balanced '' view like yours ?
the fact of the matter is that the eu has n't negotiated in good faith .
just look at some of the utterances coming out of the mouths of juncker , barnier , tusk and verhofstadt .
the uk are the ones acting on bad faith .
may unilaterally announced that the uk would leave the customs union and single market without consulting eire .
they know so little they didnt even think about the possible ramifications .
cu and sm are key to gfa and relations with eire .
`` without consulting eire '' .
newsflash pal - this was a decision made by the people of the uk , in the interests of the uk .
that 's your view but then if you act unilaterally that is acting in bad faith to your allies and neighbours .
referendum did n't say anything about cu or sm .
you accuse the eu in acting in bad faith but i ca n't see how ?
cause they wo n't bend to the uks absurd demands ?
keep fighting for what is right , ireland !
you 're also doing us a massive favour .
friends do n't let friends leave the eu # stopbrexit
nicely put @ twitterid
so we as a nation will be held to ransom by ireland ?
no , friends should allow a country to excercise its democratic will .
and the good friday agreement gives the people of ni that power .
if majority favour rule from the republic then it will happen .
just like brexit happened based on a democratic vote .
yes i do realise that .
and i wish there was an easy resolution .
if the eu had n't attempted to transform itself from a trading bloc to a superstate then the vote would never have happened .
i find it difficult to understand uk stance insistent on regulatory divergence .
despite hysterical reporting in right wing press , eu regulations enforce high standards respected in all trading blocs & countries .
possibile that # brexiteers wants a basement economy ?
# stopbrexit
# brexiteers : treat your country like everything else : pile it high and sell it cheap !
if n.i has a customs union does that mean eng will not and so different rules prevail there ?
surely one in all in ?
can not imagine eng & n.i have different customs status .
that would mean ruk has to stay in single market and customs union as well .
quietly !

documents.title: flying high
text: ryanair flew 9.3 million passengers on its planes last month , the airline has said , a 6 % rise from the 8.8 million it carried in november last year .
its planes were also fuller , as its `` load factor '' edged up to 96 % from 95 % last year .

documents.title: greater scrutiny for bitcoin trades ?
text: bitcoin could face tighter regulation , to tackle money laundering and tax evasion .
the uk government is negotiating changes to eu-wide legislation which would mean that bitcoin exchanges are obliged to carry out due diligence on customers and report and sus transactions .
a treasury spokesman said : `` we have clear tax rules for people who use crypto-currencies and like all tax rules , these are kept under review .
`` we also intend to update regulation to bring virtual currency exchange platforms into anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing regulation . ''

documents.title: rio tinto names new chairman
text: mining giant rio tinto has named its new chairman .
after a nine-month search simon thompson , one of its non-executive directors , has been given the job .
he will take up the position in march when jan du plessis steps down .
mr plessis is joining bt group .
mr thompson has previously worked in the metals division of anglo american and was chairman of tullow oil .

documents.title: are pension funds playing it too safe ?
text: many pension funds - particularly , the older more generous ones , the so-called defined benefit pensions - are invested in very safe investments , like government bonds .
sir brian souter , best known as the founder of the transport company stagecoach , but who is also president of the institute of chartered accountants of scotland , is urging change .
with returns on bonds so low , pension funds need to be more adventurous he argues .
`` all money in government bonds is sterile .
`` if it 's a private pension fund , then why is 60 % of money tied up with the government .
it undermines all principles .
the idea is to have a portfolio of assets , '' he says .
he points to canada where a pension fund bought an airport .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: how will brexit affect uk pharma ?
text: the impact of brexit on the uk medical sector is the focus of an mps ' inquiry tomorrow .

ahead of the meeting , pharma companies and experts have submitted evidence warning of potential risks including customs duties , additional costs for medicine and fears that border controls could hold up drugs reaching the uk .
rachel reeves , who chairs the business , energy and industrial strategy ( beis ) committee , says access to new medical products may also be at risk .
`` any divergence from european standards could possibly mean that it takes longer to get drugs to market in the uk which of course would be very worrying , '' she says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: facebook and google face oz inquiry
text: there could be trouble brewing in australia for facebook and google .
competition regulators there will be investigating the impact that the two social media firms are having on the australian media and advertising markets .
it 's estimated the two firms claim up to 40 % of all the money spent on advertising in the country .

`` we will examine whether platforms are exercising market power in commercial dealings to the detriment of consumers , media content creators and advertisers , '' said rod sims , the chairman of the australian competition and consumer commission .

documents.title: fewer children taking part-time jobs
text: new figures suggest the number of school-age children in part-time jobs has fallen by more than a fifth in the last five years .
data obtained by the bbc under a freedom of information request shows there 's been a steady decline in the number of child employment permits issued by local authorities .
angus holford is an economist at the institute for social and economic research .
he is sceptical over whether the data is recording the number accurately .
many children will be working for organisations which do not have the correct permit , he says .
his research shows that part-time work can be detrimental to the gcse results of girls , but had a negligible impact on boys .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: murdoch revives disney talks - reports
text: the times and the financial times report that rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox has resumed talks to sell a big chunk of its assets to walt disney .
the times says that disney is keen to buy fox 's film studio , tv production business , cable tv networks and international businesses .
that would include fox 's 39 % stake in sky .
disney is keen to get hold of film and tv content as it is launching a new streaming service , the report says .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to monday 's business live page .
the newspapers are reporting that rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox has revived talks to sell its stake in sky , and other businesses , to walt disney .
facebook and google have been targeted by competition regulators in australia .
and uk authorities are launching a crackdown on bitcoin , reports the telegraph .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
